results.title: Hypersomnolence with beta-adrenergic blockers.
results.text_hl: Upon replacement of @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, he felt better but continued to be quite @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolent@@@.

citations.NLM: Thachil J, Zeller JR, Kochar MS. Hypersomnolence with beta-adrenergic blockers. Chest. 1987 Nov;92(5):943-4. PMID: 3665616
citations.BibTeX: @article{3665616, title={Hypersomnolence with beta-adrenergic blockers.}, author={Thachil J and Zeller JR and Kochar MS}, journal={Chest}, volume={92}, number={5}, pages={943-4}}

results.title: [SECONDARY PREVENTION OF ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION IN VEHICLE DRIVERS--EFFICIENCY, SPECIFIC SAFETY].
results.text_hl: RESULTS: @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@Ramipril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were efficient in 77.4 and 91.6% of the cases respectively; side effects were documented in 23.9 and 10.9%, @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolence@@@ and apathy in 13%, signs of @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolence@@@ in 2.2% of the cases.

citations.NLM: Elgarov AA, Aramisova RM, Elgarov MA, Kalmykova MA. [SECONDARY PREVENTION OF ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION IN VEHICLE DRIVERS--EFFICIENCY, SPECIFIC SAFETY]. Klin Med (Mosk). 2015;93(4):31-8. PMID: 26155707
citations.BibTeX: @article{26155707, title={[SECONDARY PREVENTION OF ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION IN VEHICLE DRIVERS--EFFICIENCY, SPECIFIC SAFETY].}, author={Elgarov AA and Aramisova RM and Elgarov MA and Kalmykova MA}, journal={Klin Med (Mosk)}, volume={93}, number={4}, pages={31-8}}

results.title: Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression.
results.text_hl: A 66-year-old man with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ presented with complaints of @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@excessive daytime sleepiness@@@ (Epworth Sleepiness Score 14/24), @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@ upon exertion, and episodes of noninjurious dream-enacting behavior.

citations.NLM: DelRosso L, Gonzalez-Toledo E, Chesson AL Jr, Hoque R. Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression. Neurology. 2012 Nov 20;79(21):2156-7. PMID: 23136263
citations.BibTeX: @article{23136263, title={Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression.}, author={DelRosso L and Gonzalez-Toledo E and Chesson AL Jr and Hoque R}, journal={Neurology}, volume={79}, number={21}, pages={2156-7}}
